install.name: Amazon Checkout Payments
install.author: RedTeam
install.description: This plugin enables standard Amazon Checkout payments

param.name: amazon_payment_method
param.label: Payment Method:
param.description: Using which payment method you want to use?

param.name: amazonPaymentsAccountId
param.label: Amazon Payment Account Id
param.description: Put your Amazon Payments Account Id here

param.name: amazon_recipientEmail
param.label: Recipient Email
param.description: This is the email Id associated with the Amazon payments account of the seller. Payment will be made to the seller who has registered this email Id with Amazon Payments. Note that the seller should have created an Amazon Payments Business account with this email Id for the payment to succeed.

param.name: verify_status
param.query: SELECT order_status_code AS st_value, order_status_name AS st_title FROM #__redshop_order_status
param.label: Order Status for successful transactions
param.description: Select the order status to which the actual order is set, if the payment transaction was successful.

param.name: invalid_status
param.query: SELECT order_status_code AS st_value, order_status_name AS st_title FROM #__redshop_order_status
param.label: Order Status for failed transactions
param.description: Select an order status for failed payment transactions.

param.name: capture_status
param.query: SELECT order_status_code AS st_value, order_status_name AS st_title FROM #__redshop_order_status
param.label: Capture Payment Status
param.description: Select an capture status for capturing payment.

param.name: amazon_variable_marketplace_fee
param.label: Variable Marketplace fee
param.description: Only for Marketplace Method.Marketplace Fee. This is the fee that you want to charge to the sellers for using your website / application. The fee can either be fixed (e.g. 0.20 USD), variable (e.g. 4%) or a combination (e.g.4% + 0.20 USD). You can charge a different fee for every payment as long as it is lesser than the maximum fee specified in the fee policy accepted by the seller. If the marketplace fee is more than the fee accepted by the seller, you have to get the seller accept the updated fee policy before the transaction can succeed.

param.name: amazon_fixed_marketplace_fee
param.label: Fixed Marketplace fee
param.description: Only for Marketplace Method.Marketplace Fee. This is the fee that you want to charge to the sellers for using your website / application. The fee can either be fixed (e.g. 0.20 USD), variable (e.g. 4%) or a combination (e.g.4% + 0.20 USD). You can charge a different fee for every payment as long as it is lesser than the maximum fee specified in the fee policy accepted by the seller. If the marketplace fee is more than the fee accepted by the seller, you have to get the seller accept the updated fee policy before the transaction can succeed.
